column7: some of them bought a lot<div>goods and their dollar amount is high
column8: some of them visit us multiple time so their <div>number of visits is high.<div><div>1 group customers by month<div><div>Jan: 30
column10: Mar 60<div><div>since we want to fully use our screen space
column11: we make bars with the same height<div>but different width<div><div>For example
column13: then Jan will be 3 in width
column14: Feb will be 2<div>and Mar will be 6<div><div>Now
column15: to fill the bar of Jan
column16: we first select out the 3 customer whose dollar amount <div>is lowest and place them on the first row of bar Jan
column17: odered them by number of visits<div>then
column18: we choose 3 lowest from the remaining
column19: place them on the second row orderd<div>by number of visit
column20: so on and so far.<div><div>When we filled all the bars

column24: the customer on the same row<div>may have totally different dollar amount
column25: that is why we need color to distinguish them.<div><div><div>the pith of pixel bar chart lays in the choose of bar divining attribute and Y-ordering attribute<div><div>The X-ordering attribute
